isis.stitle: TSI 05-16-02R - Hoses for Add-On AC Evaporators

geninfo.para: In some applications it may be advantageous to add an additional AC evaporator to cool remote areas such as a sleeper compartment. This letter provides the part numbers of the needed hoses and the procedure to accommodate these additions.

partsinfo.para: Hose, A/C assy accumulator to compressor (for I6 engine) - 2585758C91
Hose, A/C assy condenser to evaporator (for I6 engine) - 2585759C91

para.emph: Post 2004 Emission DT 466 and 570 Engines, Low Mount Cab

warning.para: To avoid property damage, personal injury or death park the vehicle on a level surface, set the parking brake, chock the wheels and turn the engine off.
Wear a face shield or other adequate eye protection when working with refrigerant. The temperature of liquid refrigerant may cause injury or blindness if the refrigerant contacts the eyes.

Wear nonporous gloves when working with refrigerant. Should liquid refrigerant come in contact with skin, remove contaminated clothing, including shoes and treat the injury as though the skin had been frostbitten. See a doctor immediately.

Refrigerant must be recovered from the air conditioning system before any components of the system are replaced. Removing components while pressure is in the system will cause personal injury or death.

step1.para: Recover the refrigerant from the AC system.
Remove the AC hose from the condenser to the evaporator and install the new hose.
Remove the AC hose from the accumulator to the compressor and install the new hose.
Install the AC hose from the new evaporator to the aux. fitting on the newly installed hose from the condenser to the evaporator.
Install the AC hose from the new evaporator to the aux. fitting on the newly installed hose from the accumulator to the compressor.

Recharge the system using R-134a refrigerant. The original truck system holds 30 oz. and the new evaporator should require an additional 16 oz. The additional requirement will vary from system to system depending on the length of hoses and the capacity of the new evaporator. The additional capacity will also require an additional 40 cc (1.2 fl. Oz.) of PAG oil in the system.

caution.para: Failure to add additional PAG oil to the increased capacity AC system will result in improper lubrication and lead to premature component failure.

step1.para: Operate the vehicle to make sure the AC is performing properly and is not leaking.
